title: Full list of famous faces named in New Year Honours 2026 | Richmond and Twickenham Times
body_text:
The actor Idris Elba, ice dancers Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean and members of the England women's national football and rugby sides have been recognised in the New Year Honours list for 2026.
The Honours are awarded based on merit or on exceptional achievement or service, and are awarded twice a year - on the King's Birthday and the New Year.
This can range from receiving a knighthood or damehood to getting a CBE, MBE, OBE or GBE.
An individual can be nominated for an Honour either by government departments or members of the public, so there is always a mix of famous faces and the general public.
Which famous faces were recognised in the New Year Honours list for 2026?
The actor Idris Elba was one of the more recognisable names on the list, with him being knighted for services to young people.
He founded the Elba Hope Foundation, which supports community empowerment, education, youth advocacy and sustainable development.
Speaking on the honour, Sir Idris, 53, said: “I receive this honour on behalf of the many young people whose talent, ambition and resilience has driven the work of the Elba Hope Foundation.
“I hope we can do more to draw attention to the importance of sustained, practical support for young people and to the responsibility we all share to help them find an alternative to violence.”
He is well-known for his roles in numerous TV shows and films, including The Wire, Luther, Pacific Rim, Zootopia, American Gangster, Prometheus and the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean have been made a Dame and Sir for services to ice skating and to voluntary service.
They took home the Olympic gold at the 1984 Winter Games in ice dancing and saw success at the World, European and British Championships.
Discussing the honour, Dame Jayne, 68, said the timing of the honours seemed “perfect” after the pair danced on the ice for the last time this year.
She said: “We had such a great time, we were so happy with the tour and the fact that we got through it.
“It was a big thing for us to mark our career before retirement, and then receiving this award at the end of the year, it’s just finished everything. It’s perfect.”
Other people within the entertainment industry who were recognised included the actor Warwick Davis and presenter and author Richard Osman being made OBEs.
It comes after Davis was given Bafta’s highest honour at its annual film awards, the Bafta Fellowship, for his performing and advocacy work back in February.
Alongside that, former Coronation Street star Sally Lindsay is made an MBE, and the actress Meera Syal is made a Dame.
Syal, 64, is known for her work on Goodness Gracious Me, The Kumars at No.42 and The Split among many other TV shows and films.
Wicked star Cynthia Erivo is also made an MBE for services to music and drama, and football commentator Clive Tyldesley becomes an OBE for services to sports broadcasting and to charity.
The comedian Bill Bailey is made an MBE for services to entertainment, and singer Ellie Goulding is made an MBE for services to biodiversity and the climate.
Writer Roy Clarke, creator of sitcoms Last Of The Summer Wine, Open All Hours and Keeping Up Appearances, is also knighted.
In the world of sport, members of England’s Lionesses featured heavily after winning the Euros this summer.
Captain Leah Williamson is made a CBE, while Alex Greenwood, Keira Walsh, Georgia Stanway and Ella Toone are made MBEs.
The team’s Dutch manager, Sarina Wiegman, is awarded an honorary damehood, the Cabinet Office said.
Members of England Women’s Rugby World Cup-winning squad are also represented, with Marlie Packer and Zoe Aldcroft becoming OBEs, along with coach John Mitchell.
Teammates Ellie Kildunne, Sadia Kabeya, and Megan Jones are made MBEs after the Red Roses defeated Canada in the final in September.
Paula Radcliffe, a three-time London Marathon winner who held the women’s marathon world record for 16 years, has been made an OBE.
Who else featured on the New Year Honours list for 2026?
Other notable people featured on the New Year Honours list include 92-year-old Betty Brown.
She is thought to be the oldest victim of the Horizon IT scandal and said it was a “shocker” to have been made an OBE for seeking justice for subpostmasters.

Meanwhile, D-Day veteran Mervyn Kersh, 101, said it is a “wonderful thing” to be awarded a British Empire Medal (BEM) for services to Holocaust remembrance and education.
The oldest on the list is 102-year-old John Hearn, one of four centenarians included, who receives a BEM for services to Judo and to the community in north-east England.
At 20, the youngest recipient this year is Olympic gold medal-winning sports climber Toby Roberts from Elstead in Surrey, who becomes an MBE.
